intro: Tragia gagei, commonly known as the African ironweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically alternate and ovate, with a rough texture. Tragia gagei is often found in dry, open habitats and is adapted to withstand arid conditions.
